title: رُبَّ
description: Learn about the particle رُبَّ - its meaning indicating paucity or abundance, its grammatical effects on the noun it governs, and its usage in classical Arabic poetry and prose.

notes.title: What is رُبَّ?
content: رُبَّ is a حَرْفُ جَرٍّ شَبِيهٌ بِالزَّائِدِ (a preposition resembling the extra/redundant particles). It is used to indicate either قِلَّة (paucity/fewness) or كَثْرَة (abundance/many), depending on context.
Unlike regular prepositions, رُبَّ only attaches to نَكِرَة (indefinite nouns) that are مَوْصُوفَة (described by an adjective or clause). This is a key grammatical rule for its usage.
keyPoints: Only enters on نَكِرَة مَوْصُوفَة (described indefinite noun)
The noun after it takes جَرّ in form but رَفْع in meaning

examples.arabic: رُبَّ أَخٍ لَكَ لَمْ تَلِدْهُ أُمُّكَ
examples.english: Many a brother you have whom your mother did not bear
Many a generous man I have met
Many a harmful thing is (actually) beneficial
Many a word said to its speaker: Leave me alone

notes.title: The Grammatical Effect of رُبَّ
content: رُبَّ causes its noun (مَجْرُور) to take كَسْرَة in pronunciation (لَفْظًا), but in terms of grammatical function (مَحَلًّا), the noun serves as the مُبْتَدَأ (subject) of the sentence in the رَفْع position.

This is why رُبَّ is called شَبِيهٌ بِالزَّائِدِ - it affects pronunciation but doesn't change the underlying grammatical role. The noun is مَجْرُورٌ لَفْظًا مَرْفُوعٌ مَحَلًّا (genitive in form, nominative in function).
keyPoints: Noun after رُبَّ: مَجْرُورٌ لَفْظًا (genitive in pronunciation)
Same noun: مَرْفُوعٌ مَحَلًّا (nominative in function)
Functions as مُبْتَدَأ (subject) of the sentence
The خَبَر (predicate) comes after the noun

examples.english: Many a matter that pleased you, its harm (was great)
Many a day I cried in it
Many a night I stayed awake through it

notes.title: رُبَّ for Paucity vs. Abundance
content: Grammarians differ on whether رُبَّ primarily indicates تَقْلِيل (paucity) or تَكْثِير (abundance). The Basran school holds that رُبَّ is primarily for تَقْلِيل (making few), while the Kufan school and some others argue it is often used for تَكْثِير (making many).
In practice, رُبَّ is frequently used for تَكْثِير in poetry and eloquent speech, especially when the speaker wants to boast or emphasize frequency. Context determines the intended meaning.
keyPoints: تَقْلِيل: indicating fewness (Basran view as primary)

examples.english: Perhaps a shot from one who is not an archer (paucity)

examples.arabic: رُبَّ حَامِلِ فِقْهٍ إِلَى مَنْ هُوَ أَفْقَهُ مِنْهُ
examples.english: Many a carrier of fiqh (carries it) to one more learned than him

examples.arabic: رُبَّ مَعْذِرَةٍ أَوْقَعَتْ صَاحِبَهَا فِي ذَنْبٍ
examples.english: Many an excuse landed its maker in sin

examples.arabic: أَلَا رُبَّ مَوْلُودٍ وَلَيْسَ لَهُ أَبٌ (شعر)
examples.english: Indeed many a born child has no father (poetry)

notes.title: Special Forms and Usage
content: رُبَّ has variant forms: رُبَّ (most common), رُبَ (without shadda), رُبَّمَا (with مَا الكَافَّة which allows it to enter on verbs), and رُبَّتَ (with تَاء التَّأْنِيث). These variants appear in classical texts.
When مَا is attached (رُبَّمَا), it كَفَّتْهَا عَنِ الْعَمَلِ (prevents رُبَّ from governing), allowing it to precede verbs. This is common in both Quran and poetry.
keyPoints: رُبَّ، رُبَ، رُبَّمَا، رُبَّتَ: variant forms
All forms share the same essential meaning

examples.arabic: رُبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ (القرآن ١٥:٢)
examples.english: Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish they had been Muslims (Quran 15:2)
Often I have ascended to a peak (poetry)
Many a night I stayed up through

examples.arabic: رُبَّمَا تَكْرَهُ النُّفُوسُ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ لَهُ فُرْجَةٌ
examples.english: Often souls hate a matter that has relief (in it)

exercises.promptEn: رُبَّ only enters on the _____ indefinite noun

exercises.prompt: الِاسْمُ بَعْدَ رُبَّ مَجْرُورٌ لَفْظًا _____ مَحَلًّا
exercises.promptEn: The noun after رُبَّ is genitive in form, _____ in function

exercises.prompt: رُبَّمَا تَدْخُلُ عَلَى _____ لِأَنَّ مَا كَافَّةٌ
exercises.promptEn: رُبَّمَا can enter on _____ because مَا is preventive

exercises.prompt: Many a brother you have whom your mother did not bear
exercises.answer: رُبَّ أَخٍ لَكَ لَمْ تَلِدْهُ أُمُّكَ

exercises.prompt: Many a generous man I have met
Many a night I stayed awake through it

exercises.answer: many a / perhaps (particle of paucity or abundance)

exercises.prompt: The مَا that prevents a particle from governing
A particle meaning 'many a' that takes indefinite described nouns
